page.title: 16FISHING INDUSTRY-DUNURE (2)
page.content: Catches have changed with over fishing of Ballantrae Bank herring spawning stock (now recovering),with new markets home and abroad for species such as hake,monkfish and nephrops (prawns),with more efficient methods and larger boats fishing further afield eg Irish Sea,The Minch and Rockall.Mechanisation has meant fewer crew men are required as nets are now often returned to makers for repair. Crew deal with catch and few boats have more than 2 men skilled in net repair.Dunure fleet once largest in Clyde now carries only 25 boats and crew from Dunure totals about 50 men. 70% of 150 strong Clyde fleet depends on prawns taken by trawl.The remainder can switch to prawn trawling but depend on short summer herring fishery otherwise nomadic changing fishing methods and grounds as necessary.
